item.title: Djokovic denied Australia entry amid visa issue
item.description: Novak Djokovic has been denied entry into Australia after initially being granted a medical exemption for the country's COVID-19 vaccination requirements so that the world's No. 1-ranked tennis player could play in the Australian Open.

item.title: Rodgers says 'bum' writer shouldn't vote for MVP
item.description: A Chicago-based reporter said he wouldn't give his MVP vote to Aaron Rodgers because he had issues with the quarterback's off-the-field habits. "I think he's a bum," Rodgers said.

item.title: NFL explores SB contingencies amid COVID spike
item.description: In the midst of rising COVID-19 cases, the NFL has explored alternative sites for next month's Super Bowl slated for SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles.

item.title: Sources: Mixon tests positive; Burrow also out
item.description: Bengals RB Joe Mixon, a first-time Pro Bowl selection who ranks second in the NFL this season with 1,205 rushing yards, will not play in the regular-season finale after testing positive for COVID-19, sources told ESPN.

item.title: Projected No. 1 pick Hutchinson declares for draft
item.description: Michigan DE Aidan Hutchinson, who was the runner-up for the Heisman Trophy after compiling 14 sacks and 16.5 tackles for loss this season, is entering the 2022 NFL draft.

item.title: UGA's Smith on facing Bama: 'I just want to win'
item.description: Georgia linebacker Nolan Smith isn't afraid to say that he cried after Alabama handed the Bulldogs their first loss of the season, a 41-24 defeat in the SEC championship game in Atlanta on Dec. 4.

item.title: IOC: Winter Olympics in Beijing will go ahead
item.description: The International Olympic Committee promised officials worldwide Wednesday the Winter Olympics in Beijing will go ahead as planned.

item.title: Rapinoe blasts ex-USSF prez for 'misogyny'
item.description: USWNT star Megan Rapinoe blasted ex-USSF president Carlos Cordeiro for his 'caveman levels of misogyny.'

item.title: NFL teams could lose pick for interview conduct
item.description: The NFL has issued a warning to teams that they could lose a draft pick and face significant fines if club representatives conduct themselves unprofessionally in interviews with draft prospects.

item.title: 'He's a perfect fit for us': Inside the Warriors' reclamation of former No. 1 pick Andrew Wiggins
item.description: Wiggins was never supposed to be a role player on a championship front-runner. He was supposed to be the foundation of one. But the Warriors didn't need that. Instead, they needed the player Wiggins had always wanted to become.

item.title: The secret MVP of sports? The port-a-potty
item.description: It's not the most glamorous side of sports, but most game days simply couldn't happen without portable toilets and the people who maintain them. We look at how the stalwart stalls have helped bring fans closer to the game.

item.title: 'You don't want to let him down': Marcus Freeman leads Notre Dame into a new era
item.description: Notre Dame is a banking on Freeman, a young, relatable coach with fresh ideas, to help the program rise from frequent CFP contender to bona fide national title threat.

item.title: 'They schemed us up good': Why opponents can't pick their poison against Nick Saban and Alabama
item.description: It's the same tale, time and again. As Cincinnati learned in the College Football Playoff semifinals, expect the unexpected against Alabama.

item.title: Max Homa is ready to be known for more than just being golf's 'Twitter guy'
item.description: With three wins on tour, Homa is working on building his game and his self-confidence as he tries to reach his ultimate golf goals.

item.title: How to watch the PGA Tour, Masters, PGA Championship and more on ESPN, ESPN+
item.description: The 2022 season marks the arrival of PGA TOUR LIVE on ESPN+.

item.title: Can Kyrie Irving play Wednesday? A game-by-game guide to the Nets star's bizarre schedule
item.description: COVID-19 vaccine mandates preclude the All-Star guard from playing in games in New York and Toronto. Here's every game where he can take the court this regular season.

item.title: From the archives: The oral history of Dirk's 1998 Nike Hoop Summit
item.description: It's the performance that set in motion a HOF career. And it took a secret trip out of Germany to make it happen.

item.title: Big questions and pivotal situations for all 32 teams
item.description: The Canes are back on top of our latest poll. Plus, we lay out the most pivotal situations for every club as 2022 gets rolling.

item.title: Kraken GM Ron Francis on what's gone wrong, plans for the future
item.description: The inaugural season of the NHL's newest franchise hasn't gone as well as some hoped.

item.title: Standouts from the 2021-22 men's college basketball season so far
item.description: For those who missed the nonconference action of the 2021-22 men's college basketball season, here are the top highlights.

item.title: A celebration of the wild, wacky and wonderful ways of bowl season
item.description: Too many opt-outs? Too many "meaningless" games? Bah humbug! It's not the most wonderful time of the year for nothing.

item.title: Ranking the top 20 WNBA free agents
item.description: Free agency plays a bigger role in the WNBA than ever. We rank the best free agents of 2022, with three of the last four MVPs topping our list.

item.title: Mbappe won't join Real Madrid in January; for now he's all business with PSG and France
item.description: New year, same Mbappe? The France and PSG superstar is likely to change clubs this summer, but he's focused on success and ignoring the noise.

item.title: Love and courage guided Eriksen and Propper to their bold decisions in 2022
item.description: The two players made their debuts on the same day, even going head-to-head in the past. On Tuesday, they made different choices as to what's next.

item.title: Tannenbaum's QB rankings: Joe Burrow stars again -- and moves up to No. 4
item.description: Mike Tannenbaum gives NFL QB ratings and details what he saw on the field under center this week, including another four-TD outing for Joe Burrow.

item.title: Power Rankings: Packers back on top, plus New Year's resolutions for all 32 teams
item.description: Russell Wilson and the Seahawks need to be better on third down.

item.title: Week 18 rankings
item.description: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and non-PPR formats.

item.title: Ferran Torres has joined Barcelona, but how is the club working around debt?
item.description: Barcelona's financial issues are well-documented, which made the arrival of Ferran Torres all the more stunning. How are they making this work?

item.title: Grading the big deals happening in January
item.description: The January transfer window is upon us. Here are the big deals and how we rate them, with Barcelona spending â‚¬55m to sign Ferran Torres.

item.title: Will USMNT's Ricardo Pepi be Augsburg's answer to Robert Lewandowski?
item.description: Pepi is the latest whiz to go to Europe from the FC Dallas academy and counts Lewandowski among his idols.

item.title: A wish for the new year: Bring on Canelo Alvarez-Gennadiy Golovkin 3, Ryan Garcia-Gervonta Davis and more
item.description: Mike Coppinger shares a list of big fights he would most like to see in 2022.

item.title: MMA predictions for 2022: Conor McGregor title shot, a star departs for boxing and a new UFC division
item.description: What could be ahead for MMA in 2022? Marc Raimondi predicts a number of big storylines that may shape the sports future.

item.title: Osaka opens her season with win in Melbourne
item.description: Naomi Osaka, playing her first tour-level match since a third-round loss at the US Open in September, defeated Alize Cornet 6-4, 3-6, 6-3 on Tuesday in one of the so-called Summer Set tournaments in Melbourne.

item.title: How much will Kyrie Irving help your team?
item.description: John Cregan puts Kyrie Irving's part-time role in perspective, when it comes to Irving's fantasy impact this season.
